title: Riot you really missed a small but golden idea for Taliyah's W
body:
You should be able to cast it on yourself as a type of wallhop mechanic. Her log-in theme and passive and recall all emphasize how much she enjoys riding on top of a rock/boulder etc. I see no reason to put it on her W allowing for a bit more mobility and putting more emphasis on how she uses the earth to move around.  Similar to how Ziggs is with how much he loves blowing shit up. So much so that he can use his satchel on himself because he doesn't care as long as things go BOOM. 


I tried to do this in game against bots while I was testing her out and got really sad to see she couldn't do so.

It's an idea that got suggested a number of times during her development that we did discuss. We didn't want to offer her the mobility that would involve though, and wanted to keep the ability distinct from Satchel Charge, so while it would be cool for the Taliyah player didn't think it was a good idea.
Just saying, but satchel charge now executes turrets. Pretty distinct already tbh. I would just stick to your first argument (balance), as distinctness really is not a valid argument here.

Zigg's Satchel Charge is used to move Ziggs and his opponents in a certain direction and allowing Talyah to do the same would put her in the same boat in terms of how close to Ziggs's ability it is - with just a smaller radius. That's what Meddler is saying.
In this case, distinctness is still the major point of the argument, balance being the second. Talyah already has the map mobility via her ultimate and MS buff on her Worked Ground, Rock Surfing near walls. Allowing her to have this mini mobility in lane as well (that is similar to a dash) would be too much.

It doesn't matter if Ziggs's Satchel Charge now has an extra effect that executes turrets below a certain treshhold, it's just one more extra way for him to use the ability than as a glorified mobility tool, which used to be the case since his creation.

There's more distinction, though. Taliyah's ability would very often involve taking the opponent along with her for a trip over the wall, while Ziggs nearly always tries to split himself and his opponent with the Satchel if he can.

It's still not enough to justify giving her what is essentially a normal mobility spell, of course, but I don't believe that Seismic Shove really overlaps with Satchel Charge that much.

If we're talking distinctiveness here, did they not see the relation between Seismic Shove and Vel'Koz's Tectonic Disruption? Both AoE, non-missile knock-backs. Even their names are ridiculously similar.
And there's the additional innate power in that Satchel charge launches them straight away from center, but Taliyah can choose the direction.
